books.title: The Law and the Lady
books.author: Wilkie Collins
books.summary: After a young woman discovers that her husband is concealing a terrible secret, she vows to discover the truth.

books.title: The Mystery of Cabin Island
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: A group of amateur detectives unravel the mystery of a missing stamps collection.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Enchanted Castle
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Three children discover a wonderful garden and castle, and come into possession of a magic ring which entangles them in many strange adventures.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: Twelfth Night
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A woman disguises herself as a man and becomes entangled in the courtship of two aristocrats.

books.title: The Lost World
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A team of scientists and adventurers explores a prehistoric land.

books.title: Anne of Avonlea
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A young woman enters adulthood as she works as a schoolteacher in a country village.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: The Leavenworth Case
books.author: Anna Katharine Green
books.summary: A young New York lawyer becomes embroiled in the investigation of the mysterious murder of a wealthy man.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: New Hampshire
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: Robert Frost’s Pulitzer-winning book of poetry.

books.title: The Works of Max Beerbohm
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A collection of satirical essays ridiculing pretentiousness through imitation.

books.title: The Inheritors
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: A young writer dabbling in journalism meets a strange, otherworldly woman with long-term political goals.

books.title: Legends of Vancouver
books.author: E. Pauline Johnson
books.summary: E. Pauline Johnson’s collection of legends and myths of the Squamish people.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
